meanings.definition: A person or machine that tabulates data.
meanings.sent1: The tabulators at the election office counted the votes accurately.
meanings.sent2: The company uses tabulators to process sales data efficiently.
meanings.sent3: The tabulators at the library sorted the books by genre.
meanings.sent4: Her mind worked like tabulators, organizing thoughts into neat categories.
meanings.sent5: The tabulators hummed softly as they tallied up the survey results.

meanings.definition: A device used for counting or calculating.
meanings.sent1: The tabulators on the cash register helped the cashier keep track of sales.
meanings.sent2: The old tabulators were replaced with a more advanced model.
meanings.sent3: The tabulators on the calculator made math homework easier.
meanings.sent4: His heart beat like a tabulator, ticking off the seconds of anticipation.
meanings.sent5: The tabulators clicked rhythmically as they added up the expenses.

meanings.definition: An individual who organizes or arranges information in a systematic way.
meanings.sent1: She was known as the office tabulator for her meticulous filing system.
meanings.sent2: The tabulator in the group kept everyone on track during the project.
meanings.sent3: The tabulator in the family always planned the holiday gatherings.
meanings.sent4: His mind was a tabulator, neatly categorizing memories into folders.
meanings.sent5: The tabulator in the classroom color-coded the study materials for easy reference.
